DOC.brief_summary: To show that having less qualified personnel (non-Laboratory trained professionals) perform the test yields the same result as if a Laboratory trained professional performed the test.
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of the AmniSure ROM Test
DOC.detailed_description: The main goal of this study is to show that when performed by less qualified personnel, the AmniSureÂ® ROM Test is so simple and accurate that the likelihood of erroneous results by the Intended-User is negligible and that the test poses no unreasonable risk of harm to the patient if performed incorrectly.
DOC.criteria: Subjects must be pregnant. Subjects must be between 18 and 50 years of age and have a gestational age of 11.042.0 weeks. Subjects reporting suspicion, signs, or symptoms suggestive of ROM, PROM, PPROM. Subjects providing informed consent. Subjects who have placenta previa. Subjects who have heavy vaginal bleeding. Subjects who have had digital vaginal examination immediately prior to evaluation for ROM.
